summary: The Pipeline Accountability Act of 2025 aims to strengthen pipeline safety and public engagement. It mandates the establishment of a Public Engagement Office within the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA). The bill also addresses carbon dioxide pipeline safety, requiring rulemakings, and updates regulations on underground natural gas storage. It enhances public access to safety data and increases accountability through stricter incident reporting and limitations on releases. It also modifies and extends funding for the Natural Gas Distribution Infrastructure Safety and Modernization Grant Program.
